typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Abbreviation
typeDescription.description: An abbreviation is a letter or group of letters, taken from a word or words. For example, the word "abbreviation" can be abbreviated as "abbr." or "abbrev."

featureDescription.name: expan
featureDescription.description: The full form of an abbreviation. For example he fullform, for example for HLA (human leukocyte antigen), O

featureDescription.name: textReference
featureDescription.description: Reference to the text span that contains the full form of the abbreviation/acronym

featureDescription.name: definedHere
featureDescription.description: The definedHere is true if the abbreviation/acronym is defined for the first time in the text, e.g. in "interleukin 2 (Il-2) receptor", it can be true only for locally introduced abbreviations/acronyms.

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Acronym
typeDescription.description: Abbreviation includes acronyms â€œwritten as the initial letter or letters of words, and pronounced on the basis of this abbreviated written form.â€

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.AdjectiveFeats
typeDescription.description: Describes a word structure, default grammatical features of a adjective

featureDescription.name: degree
featureDescription.description: Degree

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.AlternativeSentence
typeDescription.description: This annotation marks the span of an alternative sentence.

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.AlternativeSentences
typeDescription.description: A set of alternative realizations of sentences, created after application of paraphrase and deletion rules.

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Annotation
typeDescription.description: The super-type for all types.

featureDescription.name: confidence
featureDescription.description: The component that made the annotation may put its confidence/score calculated internally here, O

featureDescription.name: componentId
featureDescription.description: Indicates which NLP component has been used to derive the annotation, C

featureDescription.name: ref
featureDescription.description: Reference to the Annotation Object that acts as a argument here

featureDescription.name: role
featureDescription.description: the role of the argument

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.AuthorInfo
typeDescription.description: AuthorInfo Type annotates the text segments containing the information about an author and his/her affiliation information.

featureDescription.name: foreName
featureDescription.description: An authorâ€™s forename,C

featureDescription.name: affiliation
featureDescription.description: Affiliation of the author, O

featureDescription.name: contact
featureDescription.description: Contact information (emails, phones, etc.), O

featureDescription.name: lastName
featureDescription.description: The last name of the author.

featureDescription.name: initials
featureDescription.description: Initials

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.AutoDescriptor
typeDescription.description: The descriptor type for automatically (i.e. algorithmically) acquired meta information. It can be refined and extended.

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Caption
typeDescription.description: the caption of figures, tables etc.

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Chunk
typeDescription.description: Chunks (non-recursive)

value.description: Adjectival chunk headed by an accusative adjective
Adjectival chunk headed by a genitive adjective
Adjectival chunk headed by a nominative adjective
Nominal chunk headed by an accusative noun
Nominal chunk headed by a dative noun
Nominal chunk headed by a genitive noun
Nominal chunk headed by a nominative noun
Nominal chunk headed by an "accusative" pou
Nominal chunk headed by a "nominative" pou
Verbal chunk headed by an active participle

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Clause
typeDescription.description: Clauses (non-recursive)

value.description: Clause headed by an active participle

featureDescription.name: ref
featureDescription.description: The reference to the Concept, we use here the super type TOP in order to avoid the recursive dependencies between type systems

featureDescription.name: textualRepresentation
featureDescription.description: This feature provides the text of the annotated concept mention (e.g., entity mention). important for easily representing discontinious mentions such as 'T cell' in th expression 'T and B cell'

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Constituent
typeDescription.description: The super-type for the constituent annotation, see subtypes

featureDescription.name: parent
featureDescription.description: The parent in a constituency tree, C

featureDescription.name: head
featureDescription.description: The head can be extracted with head rules, O

featureDescription.name: cat
featureDescription.description: The category of the constituent (e.g. NP, VP)

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Date
typeDescription.description: Type to store dates

featureDescription.name: day
featureDescription.description: day of the month, C

featureDescription.name: month
featureDescription.description: month of the year, C

featureDescription.name: year
featureDescription.description: full year (e.g. 2006 and NOT 06), C

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Deletable
typeDescription.description: A text span that is a candidate for deletion.

featureDescription.name: relevance
featureDescription.description: Deletable segments canl be sorted on this feature. Those that are less "relevant" to the document should be deletede first.

featureDescription.name: head
featureDescription.description: This is the annotation that belongs to the deletable and heads the deletable.

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.DependencyRelation
typeDescription.description: Syntactic dependency relation annotation, see subtypes

featureDescription.name: head
featureDescription.description: Head (Token) of the analyzed dependency relation, C

featureDescription.name: projective
featureDescription.description: The dependency relations can be projective or not, C

featureDescription.name: label
featureDescription.description: The label of the relation (e.g. SBJ, OBJ, DEP)

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Descriptor
typeDescription.description: An abstract type for the document descriptors, there are two subclasses: one for automatically acquired meta information and one for meta information that was added manually (such as e.g. MeSH term lists)

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.DiscontinuousAnnotation
typeDescription.description: Chains annotations of the same type

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: Annotations to be chained.

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.DocType
typeDescription.description: The document type

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.DocumentAnnotation
typeDescription.description: The super-type for the document annotation types (Header, Descriptor)

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Encoding
typeDescription.description: Encoding Information

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.EntityMention
typeDescription.description: (Named) EntityMention (i.e. An entity is an object or set of objects in the world. Entitiy mentions may be refrenced in a text by their name, indicated by a common noun or noun phrase, or represented by a pronoun) annotation

featureDescription.name: head
featureDescription.description: Head of an entity mention such as Northwest in the Northwest

featureDescription.name: mentionLevel
featureDescription.description: mention level such as PRO (many), NOM, NAM (see ACE)

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.GrammaticalFeats
typeDescription.description: Describes a word structure, default grammatical features dependent of a word category, see subtypes

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Header
typeDescription.description: The Header type stores the bibliographical document information.

featureDescription.name: docType
featureDescription.description: The type of the document (e.g. abstract, fulltext, randomized), C

featureDescription.name: source
featureDescription.description: The source of the document (e.g. WWW, Database), C

featureDescription.name: docId
featureDescription.description: The identifier of the document with respect to its source. E.g.: PMID in PubMed. In combination with the source, this is a unique identifier for a document, C

featureDescription.name: copyright
featureDescription.description: Copyright information, C

featureDescription.name: truncated
featureDescription.description: Indicates whether the document is truncated, C

featureDescription.name: authors
featureDescription.description: The authors of the document, O

featureDescription.name: title
featureDescription.description: The title of the document, C

featureDescription.name: language
featureDescription.description: The language of the document, O

featureDescription.name: uri
featureDescription.description: URI of document. (For example, file:///MyDirectory/myFile.txt for a simple file or http://incubator.apache.org/uima/index.html for content from a web source.)

featureDescription.name: offsetInSource
featureDescription.description: Byte offset of the start of document content within original source file or other input source. Only used if the CAS document was retrieved from an source where one physical source file contained several conceptual documents. Zero otherwise.

featureDescription.name: dct
featureDescription.description: Document Creation Time

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Keyword
typeDescription.description: A term of a controlled keyword list to describe the content of the publication.

featureDescription.name: name
featureDescription.description: The name of the keyword, C

featureDescription.name: source
featureDescription.description: Tthe keyword source (terminology), O

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Language
typeDescription.description: The language of the document. Possible values: based on ISO-639-1 language codes; we start with a first selection (which might be extended later).

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Lemma
typeDescription.description: Lemma is the canonical form of a lexeme. Lemma can be retrieved from lexicon or be produced by lemmatizer.

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: The value of lemma,C

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Link
typeDescription.description: An internal or external link.

featureDescription.name: link
featureDescription.description: The URL the link points to.

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.ManualDescriptor
typeDescription.description: The descriptor type for the manually added information.

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.NounFeats
typeDescription.description: Describes a word structure, default grammatical features of a noun

featureDescription.name: gender
featureDescription.description: Gender, C

featureDescription.name: case
featureDescription.description: Case. C

featureDescription.name: number
featureDescription.description: Number, C

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Orthography
typeDescription.description: As more than one value might apply to a token, there is a StringList that can be filled with all values that apply for this token.

value.description: Every character is a lowercase letter: token
Every character is an uppercase letter: TOKEN
The first character is an uppercase letter; all other characters are lowercase letters: Token
There is more than one uppercase letter in the token: ToKEn
The token is a single uppercase letter: T
with one or more hyphens: token-token
The token is a single uppercase letter followed by a dot: T.
The token is an arithmetic or algebraic operator
The token is an opening or closing bracket, brace, parenthesis
The token is any sequence of characters that does not match any of the above descriptions

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.POSTag
typeDescription.description: POS is a linguistic category of words (tokens) that are defined by their particular syntactic/morphological behaviours (e.g. noun, verb).

featureDescription.name: tagsetId
featureDescription.description: Every POS tagset (see subtypes) may have an identifier, C

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: The value of POS (NN, JJ etc.)

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Paragraph
typeDescription.description: A paragraph is a self-contained unit of discourse in a written text dealing with a particular point or idea.

featureDescription.name: paraType
featureDescription.description: the type of the paragraph (e.g. title)

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Paraphrase
typeDescription.description: A paraphrase matching a text span.

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.ProcessingParameter
typeDescription.description: A parameter to send to an AE.

featureDescription.name: name
featureDescription.description: Name of the parameter

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: Value of the parameter

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.ProcessingParameters
typeDescription.description: An FS array of parameters to be passed to AEs sitting behind UIMA-AS services.

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: FSArray of processing parameters

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.PronounFeats
typeDescription.description: Describes a word structure, default grammatical features of pronouns

featureDescription.name: gender
featureDescription.description: Gender

featureDescription.name: case
featureDescription.description: Case

featureDescription.name: number
featureDescription.description: Number

featureDescription.name: person
featureDescription.description: Person

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.RelationMention
typeDescription.description: Binary Relation between Entitiy Mentions

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.ResourceEntry
typeDescription.description: The reference to an external resource

featureDescription.name: source
featureDescription.description: The name of the resource, C

featureDescription.name: entryId
featureDescription.description: The identifier of the entry, C

featureDescription.name: version
featureDescription.description: The version of the resource, C

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Section
typeDescription.description: a section is a part of the text that often has a heading, an id, a section type, figures, tables, citations and footnotes that occur in this section

featureDescription.name: sectionHeading
featureDescription.description: the title of the section

featureDescription.name: sectionType
featureDescription.description: the type of the section (e.g. results)

featureDescription.name: textObjects
featureDescription.description: the text objects (figure, table, boxed text etc.) that are associated with a particular section

featureDescription.name: sectionId
featureDescription.description: the id of the section as mentioned in the XML file

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Sentence
typeDescription.description: This annotation marks the span of a sentence.

featureDescription.name: casing
featureDescription.description: see gr.ilsp.types.Orthography. Only uppercase (THIS IS A SENTENCE), lowercase (this is a sentence), and capitalized (This Is A Sentence) can apply in the context of sentence casing.

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Simplex
typeDescription.description: Represents a morpheme of a compound.

featureDescription.name: lemma
featureDescription.description: The lemma of the simplex, C

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.StemmedForm
typeDescription.description: Represents a grammatical morpheme, identifies the morpheme's base form for the current token, activat- for activation. Different forms can be produced by stemmers.

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: The value of the stemmed form, C

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Style
typeDescription.description: Text-markup information (italic, bold etc.) on any (e.g. character) level. Allows to keep the original style markup of the text, several style types might be set to same (or overlapping) range, when different styles are set to the same text region.

featureDescription.name: styleName
featureDescription.description: the name of the style used.

featureDescription.name: encoding
featureDescription.description: the encoding used.

featureDescription.name: Rank
featureDescription.description: Sentence ranking in summary

featureDescription.name: Score
featureDescription.description: Sentence summary worthiness

featureDescription.name: Sref
featureDescription.description: Sentence reference in document

featureDescription.name: TF
featureDescription.description: Term Frequency

featureDescription.name: IDF
featureDescription.description: Inverted Document Frequency (adjusted)

featureDescription.name: rule
featureDescription.description: Term Grammar Rule id

featureDescription.name: n_of_words
featureDescription.description: Number of words

featureDescription.name: Name
featureDescription.description: Term Name

featureDescription.name: FullName
featureDescription.description: Full Term Name

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.TextObject
typeDescription.description: Object, on our case, are annotations such as figures, tables, boxed text etc.

featureDescription.name: objectType
featureDescription.description: such as figure, table, boxed-text etc.

featureDescription.name: objectId
featureDescription.description: the id of the object as found in the text

featureDescription.name: objectLabel
featureDescription.description: the label of an object

featureDescription.name: objectCaption
featureDescription.description: the caption that comes with the object

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Title
typeDescription.description: Title annotates titles covering various text units, including the whole paper, sections and subsections.

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Token
typeDescription.description: Token annotation marks the span of a token and takes all additional annotations that are on the token level, including Part-of-Speech information, lemma, stemmed form, grammatical features such as gender, number and orthographical information; furthemore, Token includes the information about dependency relations to other tokens (see correspondent annotation types for further infromation).

featureDescription.name: lemma
featureDescription.description: the lemma information, O

featureDescription.name: posTag
featureDescription.description: The full posTag, including morphosyntactic features.

featureDescription.name: stemmedForm
featureDescription.description: Contains the stemmed form of token (see StemmedForm), O

featureDescription.name: feats
featureDescription.description: Contains grammatical features correspondent to the part-of-speech tag of current token (see GrammaticalFeats and subtypes), O

featureDescription.name: orthogr
featureDescription.description: see gr.ilsp.types.Orthogrpahy

featureDescription.name: sentOrd
featureDescription.description: Order of this token in the sentence it belongs.

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.VerbFeats
typeDescription.description: Describes a word structure, default grammatical features of a verb

featureDescription.name: tense
featureDescription.description: Tense

featureDescription.name: person
featureDescription.description: Person

featureDescription.name: number
featureDescription.description: Number

featureDescription.name: voice
featureDescription.description: Voice

featureDescription.name: aspect
featureDescription.description: Aspect

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.Zone
typeDescription.description: A Zone is a distinct division of text. It is an abstract Type and provides a parent type for sub-types which represent various kinds of text zones.

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.ace.ART
typeDescription.description: ACE Agent Artifact

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.ace.ART_Inverse
typeDescription.description: ACE Agent Artifact

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.ace.FAC
typeDescription.description: Facility

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.ace.GEN_AFF
typeDescription.description: ACE

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.ace.GEN_AFF_Inverse
typeDescription.description: ACE

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.ace.LOC
typeDescription.description: Location

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.ace.ORG
typeDescription.description: Organization

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.ace.ORG_AFF
typeDescription.description: ACE Organization-Affiliation

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.ace.ORG_AFF_Inverse
typeDescription.description: ACE Organization-Affiliation

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.ace.PART_WHOLE
typeDescription.description: ACE Part-whole

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.ace.PART_WHOLE_Inverse
typeDescription.description: ACE Part-whole

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.ace.PER
typeDescription.description: Person

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.ace.PER_SOC
typeDescription.description: ACE Personal-Social

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.ace.PER_SOC_Inverse
typeDescription.description: ACE Personal-Social

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.ace.PHYS
typeDescription.description: ACE Physical

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.ace.PHYS_Inverse
typeDescription.description: ACE Physical_Inverse

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.ace.VEH
typeDescription.description: Vehicle

typeDescription.name: gr.ilsp.types.ace.WEA
typeDescription.description: Weapon
